keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS and LIZETTE ALVAREZ
byline.contributor: Jeremy W. Peters reported from Washington, and Lizette Alvarez from Orlando, Fla.

lead_paragraph: Republicans offer spiritual support and sympathy for the massacre victims in Orlando, Fla., but do not appear to budge on legal protections for gays.

headline.print_headline: A Death Toll Fails to Narrow a Chasm on Gay Rights
headline.main: After Orlando, a Political Divide on Gay Rights Still Stands

snippet: Republicans offer spiritual support and sympathy for the massacre victims in Orlando, Fla., but do not appear to budge on legal protections for gays.
abstract: Many in gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender community insist that warm words or sympathetic statements made by Republicans in wake of Orlando, Fla, mass shooting are unacceptable in light of way Republican across country have sought to limit protections for LGBT people.
